definition: alcove/bay in a room/unit of length used for rooms, approx. 3.3 meters

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: I don't work in the open-plan office anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不用再大開間辦公室裏工作了。

sentences.english: Using SAP2000 establish a large bay multi-ribbed composite wall isolation model.
sentences.chinese: 利用SAP2000建立大開間密肋複合板隔震模型。

sentences.english: It is a natural one because the width, it is also standard width of a room.
sentences.chinese: 因爲是就一自然間的寬度而言，故又稱開間。

sentences.english: Dacheng Dian ridge top nine, seven-room, the grand style.
sentences.chinese: 大成殿九脊頂，七開間，造型宏偉。

sentences.english: The interlayer displacement of end bay of the top story is maximal.
sentences.chinese: 頂層端部開間層間位移最大。

sentences.english: The machine room is rectangular with large space. It can be divided freely. The utilization rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 機房爲長方形大開間，可自由分割，利用率非常高。
